Replies.Reply: Closing fast. MUSTANG, THIS IS GHOST RIDER ONE ONE SEVEN. CONTACT ONE BOGEY, 090 AT 15 MILES, 900 KNOTS OF CLOSURE.
I don't see anything.  MAVERICK, YOU HAVE A TRAILER?
NEGATIVE, COUGAR. LOOKS LIKE HE'S SINGLE.
I've got a six strobe.  I think he's locked on us.
These guys are getting on my nerves.
GHOST RIDER TO MUSTANG. BANDITS TURNING AWAY.
Bring it left. Bring it left, You're high.
You're not. We're level. Look at the instruments, we're okay!
We're not! Trust me! We're okay.
We're on vapor, Cougar, you got to put it down.
TELL HIM, WILL YOU TELL HIM? OUR INSTRUMENTS ARE OKAY.
Look at the weather! They'll never find us! We're near out of fuel. Put it down.
You'll have mine, Cougar. It'll be where your head used to be.
You will put it up front, with the Porsches?
Can you check under the hood. I thought I heard a funny noise.
Is it extra for the hot wax?

On behalf of your Captain and your crew, I want to thank you for flying VF101. And next time your plans include the middle of the goddamn ocean in the dead of frigging night, I hope you'll think of Naval Aviation.
Never mind my head, check my shorts!
Don't worry. I'll talk to him.
He's the best you have. He's going Top Gun!
Turn around, pay attention. What are you doing?
I don't know, Frank, anybody gets off on bombing the shit out of dirt has got to be queer.
Keller, Black Lion Squadron. I knew him at Pensacola. He's damn good.
Gotta keep track of the competition.
Slider -- they let you into Top Gun? If you're among the best in the Navy, I tremble for the security of this country.
The list is long, but distinguished.
You think you can stay up with us.
Could use a dash more jet fuel.
Mayday! Down in flames!  He throws a beer in Sundown's face, quenching the fire. Sundown blinks through the beer.
No shit! That why they call him Ice?
Hey Mav, this is Sally. She doesn't believe a word I say. Tell her I'm married, will you?
We're here because we're the best flyers in the wing. Not because of some MiG encounter.
Pay no attention to it. They're just trying to rattle you. It's all psychological. Sit down..and drink.
The family unit -- that's the most important thing. It's the only thing you can count on. I'm married --did I tell you that?
I've been married since I was eighteen. Why don't you believe me?
I take it off when I'm chasing women. It's the only honorable thing to do.
One and a half, actually. I got a polaroid.
It's just like he says, sir.
On your six -- coming hard. Four hundred. Losing airspeed! He's on your six and closing fast!
Take it down. Let's bug out of here. Call for a draw.
He's out of energy! You got control? Unload!
He's right. We're at ten thousand.
Look, Ma, top of the world!
Just once, if they take your plane away.
You won. Congratulations.		HOLLYWOOD Maverick and Goose won too.
We won! Ice turns back, stares them down, then turns back into his locker, dismissing them.
Yes, sir. By the time we could respond, we were diving right into his view.
Man, you guys gooned it. Your laser butts are scattered across KANSAS.
Have you guys ever considered career counseling?
What did you do? You broke it!
That's what she said last night.
Come on, I got over six bucks on the line.
Come on, come on! It's double or nothing.. We're talking twelve bucks American, here.
They should have warned you about that one.
Seemed not to. But it's hard to know. You never can tell what's in the mind of a psychopath.
Bogey at three o'clock high! Nose on!
Don't be greedy. Stay with Wood.
Two bogies ! Three o'clock high, nine o'clock high! Break!
Sure, honey, I understand. It's great to see you. Hey where's your backseater, where's the world's smallest RIO..
Plane's coupling up! Plane's coupling up!
BOGEY ON YOUR SIX. I'M ON HIS.
Okay boys, pull out with your hands up and nobody'll get hurt.
COUGAR, BREAK LEFT. TRY A HIGH G ROLL UNDERNEATH. BREAK OUT THE BOTTOM.
Ah, the thrill of victory and the agony of defeat.
Call the ball?  I don't see the ship!
HEY, ANY OF YOU GUYS SEEN AN AIRCRAFT CARRIER AROUND HERE?
COUGAR, THIS IS MAVERICK. HALF ROLL IT. NOW!
YOU'RE NOT IN THE STRAPS.  IT'S VERTIGO, THAT'S ALL IT IS. STAY ON MY WING. I'LL DROP YOU OFF.
NO JOKE, COUGAR. ON THE LEVEL.
Yes sir. I do sir  The CHP adjusts his own aviator shades.
Sir. You are going to give me a warning, Sir!
Sir. I was going Mach point one five.
No sir! But you have to be ready.   The cop nods and stares at him.
Yeah, he's married--but then again, he,s not dead.
I think I can work it out on my own.
I've heard of you, too. You were in 124 with Bargamian.
What do these guys think, I made Cougar quit?
Well, it is. It is that, too.
Save you from a big mistake with that other guy.
Then what are you doing here?
My fault. Should have watched where I was going.
Can I walk you out?She turns back to him, a smile.
It would have been really embarrassing!
No, I beg yours. But I don't think you're right on that.
I saw a MiG do a 4 G negative dive.
It's classified. Like Hollywood says, I could tell you, but then I'd have to kill you.
Yes, ma'am, At first. Then I was directly above him.
Why didn't you tell me you were a TAGREF?
You let me make a fool of myself.
I've lost him -- where is he?
No way. I'll nail him this time. Going vertical.
No way. I got you, sucker. You're going down.
We weren't below for more than ten seconds. There was no danger. I had the shot. I took it.
That stuff about the MiG. I was out of line.
Give me a break, I'm asking you out.
Don't worry, I'm a new strain. And I don't give up. Everything I've ever wanted I've had to work like hell for. Well, how about it?
How about anything, anything you want to do.
You're slow to engage. But you'll come around.
Somebody does. It's more honest this way. You do your own dirty work.
About as much as they think about killing me.
people don't get to die for something.
You use your mind to keep things at a distance. You ever just let go?
Stick with me, you'll get used to it.
I wasn't thinking. I just did it.
Don't chew it, you won't have it that long. Easier to clean the cockpit if it comes up in big chunks.
The girl with the purple fingernails was Coogan's sister.
Keep your shirt on, he's saying holy shit it's us.
STAY WITH HIM! TIGHTEN YOUR TURN!
What's the range, Goose. I've got a good tone.
I can take care of myself.
It's my own way. It works for me. I don't care about the rest of that stuff.
For the same reason you are.
The flying. The fighting.  I'd go up there ten times a day to fight. I'd win at least nine of them. That's all I want to do. It's what I do best. I am real good.  Just give me the jet.
I guess that's what I'm doing, then.
COME OFF RIGHT--COME OFF HIGH--I'M IN--I'LL ENGAGE.
COME OFF--COME OFF RIGHT. I'M ON MY WAY IN. YOU GO FREE, I'M ENGAGING.
YOU CAN'T SHOOT HIM, I CAN. I'M IN.
ICE, ROLL OFF, I CAN SHOOT HIM.
IF YOU CAN'T SHOOT HIM, I CAN.
Go ahead. I can't reach. 2000 feet!
You don't have to do this.
I'm not good company. I should be alone.
If we knew then, what we know now, we might never have come up out of there.
What do you do when you come here?
Strip reality! How do you play that?
You came to the right place.
Big talk for someone who's never been shot off her computer.
You've already made up your mind.
Here, let me get this. We'll be even.
He was by the book, all the way.
Would you take me back? Would they?
VOODOO, GHOST RIDER ONE. I'M ON THE WAY. WAIT FOR ME.
MAVERICK'S EMGAGED. HARD LEFT, ICE, PADLOCK THE EASTERN SECTION.
Goddamnit, Mav, you really are a slow learner. Don't worry, Fung, I've got it.
You go. I'm staying with it.
ALL RIGHT, ICE. COME HARD STARBOARD, THEN EXTEND TO THE EAST.   Fungus is still lividly frazzled.
I GOT A WINDER LEFT, BUT NO GOOD TONE ON IT.
I GOT NO TONE. IT MIGHT GET YOU.
WHEN I SHOOT, YOU BREAK LEFT..3..2  The MiG fires.
MUSTANG, THIS IS MAVERICK, REQUEST A FLYBY.
BOSS, YOU BETTER CLEAR IT OUT, WE'RE FIVE MINUTES OUT AND WE'RE DOING IT!
That's okay. I always look forward to a challenge.   Now she laughs back and puts her arms around him. She kisses him and now she doesn't give a damn who sees it.
It's a MiG 21. They don't have radar missiles!
We're locked on MiG ONE. Why doesn't he disengage?
This is crazy. How the hell we supposed to land on something we can't even see!
Help me with this one, I'm really screwed up.
Can't you feel it? I'm hanging in my straps!
They must be broken. I'm hanging in my straps! We're inverted!
It's crazy, man. Instruments are crazy. We're gonna have to eject.
I'M HANGING IN MY STRAPS. I TURN IT OVER AND I'M STILL HANGING IN MY STRAPS. WHAT THE HELL IS GOING ON UP HERE?
I'M UPSIDE DOWN. I KNOW IT. I'M GONNA EJECT.
Thinking of my wife and kid.
Speaking of feet, fuel's down to 4.0.  We're gonna get them wet unless we find a Sonoco station.
What makes you think we can get back in?  We don't have the fuel for this.
He's nine o'clock high. We're two thousand pounds low!
NEGATIVE, GHOST RIDER, THE PATTERN'S FULL.
Goose, can you hear me?  Goose!
34.  STINGER'S CABIN  The skipper works at his desk, responds without looking up.
Cougar, what is it? You should be in sick bay. What are you doing?
I talked a man back once. Three months later, we lost him. It's his decision. Only he knows.
and he needs someone to fly the plane.
I didn't do it, he did it himself. Something about a wife and kid. The fact is, he's lost it. He knows it. I know it. You were up there, you know it, too.
just can't seem to follow orders!
MiG killers! You name it, boy. Sky's the limit. You name it. A medal. Anything you want. Anything.
Son. Do you know why I stopped you?
Lieutenant, do you know how fast you were going?
One SIXTH the speed of sound!
Uh oh, police escort. This one must be a real killer.
What do you think it was? Was it that MiG contact that did it?
Below the hard deck doesn't count. You guys are the second team, aren't you?
MIG'S IN A LEFT. MIG'S IN A LEFTHAND. I'M ENGAGING.
STAY WHERE YOU ARE. HE'S MINE. I'M ENGAGED. I'M IN.
GET OUT OF THERE, YOU'RE UNSAFE. GET OUT OF THERE.
STAY OUT OF IT. STAY OUT OF IT, MAVERICK.
NO, I GOT HIM. I CAN TAKE HIM.
MUSTANG, THIS IS VOODOO ONE, WE ARE ON STATION.
THEY'RE JUST HASSELING. LET'S WORK THEM OUT OF THE AREA.
MUSTANG, WE HAVE FOUR MIGS IN THE AREA OF BULLSEYE. REQUEST YOU LAUNCH THE ALERT 5 FOR SUPPORT.
VOODOO ONE, MUSTANG. VOODOO THREE IS HIT. GOING DOWN. WILL ATTEMPT SAR.
Do you have them? Did they get out or not?
MUSTANG, GHOST RIDER. PERMISSION TO FIRE.
ROGER. ENGAGING. I HAVE THE LEAD.
TWO MIGS ON MY TAIL, MAVERICK. I'M DEFENSIVE.
LOOK OUT!   They look up. An MiG 21 is coming down, belly to them, close to a mid-air collision.
GOOD TONE, FOX ONE  The MiG starts turning.
I CAN'T LOSE HIM, CAN YOU GET OFF A SHOT?
WHAT CHOICE DO I HAVE?   SHOOT IT.
I guess I owe you one.
You're a hell of a flyer.
You can be my wingman any time.
MiG killers!  What else is there?
By the end of Vietnam we upped our kill ratio to thirteen to one.   He turns on the lights. We see his audience in F.G.
You're here 'cause you're the top one per cent of all naval aviators.
With the tensions in the world today, the potential for confron- tation is greater than ever, and carrier pilots will be the first ones there. Air combat excellence is vital.
Considering the company you're in, that's a pretty arrogant attitude.
Gentlemen, this is about combat. Remember, there are no points for second place. Dismissed.
What're you laughing at? You're Fungus.

Now to continue. In this class we will be dealing with F-5's and A4's, as our MiG simulators. Technically the F-5 does not have the thrust to weight ratio of the MiG-21--it also does not bleed energy below 300 knots like the MiG-21 does. The A4 does not turn as well as the MiG-17 but has significantly better visibility.
Hi, Charlie. Good, our TAGREF's here. Charlie's the most qualified to get into P subs and curves, and VN diagrams.
Is that how you remember it?
The hard deck for this hop was ten thousand feet. Jester, at what point did you call off the fight?
The rules of engagement are not flexible. They exist for your safety. You will obey them.
"Maverick!"  He throws the report on the desk.
escape. You make a bad choice. Roll forward.
Big gamble with a thirty million dollar plane!
KNOCK OFF THE CHATTER, TOP GUNS. LET'S RTB. VIPER HAS THE LEAD.
Twenty years' experience, I couldn't shake you. You may be a great flyer. I mean that.

Nine out of ten is okay, as long as it's only fun and games. But this isn't about that. This is serious business. It is dangerous up there! At 500 knots, things can change a lot in a second. Discipline is what protects us.
If you fly jets long enough, something like this happens to you. No one escapes it. It touches us all.
My first squadron in Vietnam, we lost eight out of eighteen planes. Ten guys. The first one kills you, but there'll be others--you can count on it.
You've got to put him in the box.
It's only been a week. Keep sending him up.
I don't know, Tim. You'll have to ask them.

We can send you back to your squadron with nothing noted on your record except "CNC" --course not completed, no explanation required. Theoretically, it doesn't hurt your career, but people always wonder about things like that.
I didn't know either. That's why I told Jester to prepare your papers.
You may not think so, but you are.
They waved him off. He thought he knew better. He hit the ramp.

I'll have to think about it. I don't know about them. I do know one thing, We've got a lot invested in you. We'd hate to lose it. Even more than those other guys, Naval Aviation needs a very few, very good men.
You're on your way. Don't bother going to BOQ. Your bags are packed.
Sixteen young men - eight flight crews - sit at attention. They are trim, fit and confident - high school heroes, college jocks.
Well, I don't know. That depends.
Well, it doesn't just happen, you gotta do something famous.
We went like this, he went like that. I say to Hollywood: Where'd he go? Hollywood says: where'd who go?
No. No. Look out, you lost it.
It's kind of ironic. All you guys have women troubles and I don't.
Until last night. Did you see the moves I was making on that girl at the party?
That's her--tall hungry woman with fire in her eyes. It was great.
I'VE GOT TWO MORE BOGEYS COMING IN AT FOUR O'CLOCK HIGH.
He got our radio, and an engine. We were lucky to make it back.
It's not the plaque. The winner can get assigned here as instructor. He gets to fight every day.
You guys are not only crazy, you're dangerous!
Nope. It's the way he flies - Ice cold. No mistakes. Wears you down. After enough time, you just get bored and frustrated, you do something stupid, and he's got you.
Her six is a ten! Uh oh, a turn to engage.
Well, we should contact and check it out.
You don't think about death up there, but you think a lot about the danger. One mistake and you're a smoking hole in the ground.
Oh yeah, it makes everything down here more meaningful. You feel a certain intensity of life, and you want to grab onto every moment.
Thirty seconds. That's all it took to blow us out of the sky.
And he's laughing. Right over the radio, He's laughing at us.
Come on. I died enough for one night.
I was a victim of circumstance.
She's kinky for flight suits--said that she'd never seen so many zippers--played with them all night. The noise alone kept me up.
That's because you don't have any women.
The girl with the purple fingernails?
Coogan spent half the night looking for her. He said he was gonna kill the son-of-a-bitch who ruined his sister.
CONTACT. TWO BOGEYS 20 RIGHT. AT 12 MILES, CLOSING.
TALLY HO. TWO MIGS AT TWO O'CLOCK LOW.
TWO MORE -- TWO MORE CONTACTS. 2-7-0 at 10 MILES. WE NEED SOME HELP HERE, MUSTANG.
Why Goose, whose butt did you kiss to get here?
I think, yeah, we'll show you a thing or two.
So I heard. Steers it pretty close. Sorry to hear about Cougar. He was a good man.
You must have soloed under a lucky star. First the MiG, then you slide into Cougar's place.
Nice. Always a good idea to show up your instructors.
And Maverick. You'll back them up, on Ready Five.
JESUS!  HEY SPLASH ONE, SPLASH ONE BANDIT! SPLASH THAT SUCKER!
Nine thirty. Bogey?  You presume that hostile?
Why do you all have such funny names?
Why do they call you Wolf?
Could I get a call sign?
I never knew it was so dangerous.
And you were with Cougar. He was my roommate in flight school.
Four times. We don't believe you.
You're not even wearing a ring.
Anything I can do to help, Lieutenant?
Yeah. Hold this. It might be safer.
That's a big comfort to me.
And on to a bigger one with you?
Was there ever a girl who didn't like fighter pilots?
I'm really flattered, Lieutenant, but I don't go out with pilots.
Where's your wing man? Who's watching your six?
You! What are you doing here?
What if Captain Dawson had come with me?
How did you know this was my car?
I don't know, Corporal. Can you do anything about this lunatic?
Lieutenant, I have a top secret clearance. The Pentagon sees to it that I know more than you.
You saw a MiG push negative 4G?
He was in a 4G Negative dive and you were on his six?
If you were directly above him, how did you see him?
So you're the reason those SALT talks failed.
You seemed determined to do that anyway.. Why didn't you tell me you were a famous MiG insulter?
You know, I'm assigned to this school. I see sixteen new hotshots every eight weeks. Your attention is flattering, but not really productive. Why don't you keep your mind on flying.
Why can't you keep this straight?
You flew it off the template. Nobody ever did that before.
The hottest moves in the world aren't gonna help you if you wind up alone.  Your wingman's got to be able to follow you. Trust you. Know that he can depend on you. It's more than just fancy flying.
There you go with those moves again.
I don't mix with the boys. I work here. Let's keep it professional.
Some one comes up hot on your six, what do you do?
You turn into him, check him out, identify friend or foe.
And if he's harmless, you disengage.
I'm starting to sense that now.
I don't enjoy watching things suffer.
You don't have to kill it.
You ever think about killing another human being?
You don't believe any of this. You don't think you'll ever die.
What if you kill yourself? Think of everything you'll miss.
I don't know. I don't like being out of control.
You always get what you want?
No fooling on base, no signs, no comments, no talk. By anyone.
I'm a professional. You guys are in my line of work.
I don't fly in anything that doesn't show movies.
What do you take me for? It's a Navy Cross.
The dark side. The price you pay for all the fun you're having. You knew about it, of course. Didn't you?
That's what you get flight pay for.
Why? You act like you didn't know one day this would happen.
You knew it. You all do. It's part of it. Maybe the most important part.
Do what, show you a good time?
Only when you're depressed. Then it passes.
Everything passes. Immutable law of the Universe.
I sit. I think. I play games.
It's strip reality, actually, like what the pilots always want to play.
and if the other one accepts that it's true, the one who says it, gets to take one item of clothing off.
Go ahead. Don't be afraid. You want to win the game, don'tcha?
The big one. The one that's most on your mind.
That wasn't fair. It was a question. Penalty round!
You didn't mean it. You didn't think. You'd do anything to take it back.
Never liked fighter pilots anyway.    He looks up trying to be angry, but he can't help it, she makes him laugh.
Long distance? I wouldn't do that to you. I'd at least talk to you.
I know exactly what you mean.

I've got a gift just like you do. My gift is I just know what people mean, even if they can't say it. It helps when you're trying to communicate with fighter pilots. Like what you just said was "I'm embarrassed, I feel I've done something wrong, that I've failed, and I don't think I can live up to the expectations of a wonderful interesting, intelligent woman like yourself." That about it?
So long, Sailor. See you on the beach sometime.
Not for long, you keep that up.
NO JOY! NO JOY! WHERE ARE YOU?
WE'RE BELOW THE HARD DECK. FIGHT'S OFF.
ROGER FOX TWO. GET YOUR BUTTS ABOVE THE HARD DECK. RETURN TO BASE IMMEDIATELY.
I don't know what to tell you, Skip.
On the run. Let's go. Move it!
ATOLL ON THE NORTHERN F-14. HE'S OUT OF THE FIGHT..
Some guys never get it back.
Well, he's in trouble and he didn't even get here yet.
Don't make an issue of it, it'll stick.
WHAT? WHERE'RE YOU--HEY, WHERE IN THE HELL ARE YOU GOING?
WHAT DO YOU MEAN? IT DOESN'T GET TO LOOK MUCH BETTER THAN THAT?
Since when did you care about paperwork?  Maverick walks away. Fungus hesitates, then follows him.
If I could fly like you I'd have everything I want. If I could fly at all. I can't fly. I can't fly like that. Nobody can. Whatever it is, you've got it!
So, you're scared--so what? You ever get a good look at me in the back seat, I'm goddamn terrified.
Let's go! Dive on those bastards!  Maverick hesitates.
Come on, man, engage. This is it. Get your nose in there.
Bandit at seven o'clock low--solo. Take him. Pull on the goddamn stick, man!
Don't tell me okay. Do it!
BREAK LEFT! BREAK LEFT!   CHAFF! FLARES!
STAY WITH HIM. YOUR SIX IS CLEAR.
ONE ON OUR SIX! BUG OUT! BUG OUT!
Don't WORRY!!!?   You've GOT it!!? Are you CRAZY?
You've got it?   Good!  Cause for a minute there, you had me worried.
Now have you got it?  Have you still got it?

Right behind you.  He is closer to the center of spin and less strongly held. It doesn't do much good, however, he can't control the plane. The only thing he can reach is the yellow and black loop; the ejection handle. He reaches for it.

Speed's up to 150.  Fungus's eyes are wide.  The earth grows larger as it rises towards them. G forces flatten them. They've long since lost the MiG. Nobody but an idiot would try to follow them in this maneuver.
What are you talking about, we gotta go!
3,000 feet.  We gotta go, man. 3,000 feet, we gotta go!
Did you plan that? Was all that something you planned?
Is there something I should know?
I think they know we're here.
Oh, no. You did the flying, I'll do the talking!  He stands up in the cockpit, gives a snappy salute.
You guys know somethin' about that?
I had to come, Willard, I got so lonesome I just couldn't stand it.
Let him go, sir. Take it easy.
Sir! Let him go. It's all right. Let him go.

To include his helmet. Stereo headphones from his walkman carry the same music from the party as he sits in the cockpit and stares at the grey water rushing under. He sits in his Tomcat on Ready 5 Alert. In the back, Fungus plays a hand computer game - Jet Attack.

Characters.Character: TELL STINGER MAVERICK HAS GOOD NEWS

Replies.Reply: AND SOME BAD NEWS. THE GOOD NEWS IS THAT ICE GOT A MIG. THE BAD NEWS IS THAT MAVERICK GOT TWO!
The Air Boss speaks to Maverick over the UHF. The Admiral, the XO and other officers watch and listen.

Sailors line the deck and search the sky. They crane their necks from their battle stations, sweating into the sun, watching for the approach of F-14's. Someone sees it--he points and SHOUTS. The F-14 appears, and every man stands and CHEERS.
